intro: Impatiens salpinx, commonly known as the spurred gentian, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers with prominent spurred petals. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are ovate and glossy, with a slightly hairy texture. Impatiens salpinx thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
